programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: A soldier falls in love with a student he meets while on two weeks' leave, and he promises to seek her out after completing his tour of duty. However, in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks, he decides to re-enlist in the army, putting their relationship to the test. Romantic drama, with Channing Tatum and Amanda Seyfried.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: The Convert
programme.desc: A preacher's past is revived during a war between two Maori tribes. Co-writer/director Lee Tamahori's action drama, starring Guy Pearce and Tioreore Ngatai-Melbourne.(n)

programme.title: Far and Away
programme.desc: Penniless Irish farmer Joseph seeks revenge on the cruel landowner who drove him from his home. However, the landlord's daughter, desperate to escape her family, persuades him to join her in seeking their fortune in America. The pair plan to stake a claim in the Oklahoma gold rush, but instead Joseph is forced to become a bare-knuckle fighter to support them. Romantic drama set in the 1890s, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: You Can Live Forever
programme.desc: After moving into a Jehovah's Witness community, lesbian teenager Jamie begins a life-changing love affair with the daughter of a prominent Witness Elder. Drama, starring Anwen O'Driscoll and June Laporte.(n)

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.title: And Justice for All
programme.desc: A crusading but struggling lawyer reluctantly defends a cold-hearted judge charged with rape. Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.(n)

programme.title: Far and Away

However, the landlord's daughter, desperate to escape her family, persuades him to join her in seeking their fortune in America. The pair plan to stake a claim in the Oklahoma gold rush, but instead Joseph is forced to become a bare-knuckle fighter to support them. Romantic drama set in the 1890s, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: British broadcaster and journalist David Frost comes up with the idea of setting up a series of exclusive televised interviews with the disgraced former president of the United States, Richard Nixon. Believing he could use the publicity as a chance to resurrect his political career and make some easy money, Nixon agrees but soon realises he has underestimated Frost. Fact-based drama, starring Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell and Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A banker is wrongly jailed for his wife's murder and over the course of a life sentence he forms a close friendship with a fellow inmate. He also earns a position of trust as book-keeper to the corrupt prison governor - but makes an enemy of his benefactor as he tries to clear his name. Frank Darabont's drama, starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A shy man struggling to cope with a recent break-up is horrified to learn his impulsive former girlfriend has had all recollection of their relationship erased from her mind. He gets even by having the same treatment, but during the procedure he relives their time together and falls for her again, leaving him determined to keep his memories. Michel Gondry's surreal romantic drama, with Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson and Elijah Wood.(n)

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: A white rapper strives to make a name for himself on the music scene, but his deprived home life on a Detroit trailer park and romantic complications put a damper on his plans as he struggles to win over the crowds and earn the respect of his peers. Drama, starring Eminem, Kim Basinger, Mekhi Phifer and Brittany Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: And Justice for All
programme.desc: A crusading but struggling lawyer reluctantly defends a cold-hearted judge charged with rape. Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon

Believing he could use the publicity as a chance to resurrect his political career and make some easy money, Nixon agrees but soon realises he has underestimated Frost. Fact-based drama, starring Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell and Kevin Bacon.(n)

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: D'Artagnan faces a race against time to rescue his kidnapped sweetheart, the queen's seamstress and confidante Constance. The young woman's survival may rest with Milady, compelling D'Artagnan to forge an uneasy alliance with his former enemy. Meanwhile, King Louis XIII faces the prospect of civil war, fuelled by conspirators within his royal court. Swashbuckling sequel, starring François Civil, Eva Green and Vincent Cassel.

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.

Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: A fresh-faced Marine's boot-camp training turns into a real tour of duty when he is sent to fight in the Gulf War in 1991. However, the desert action is not what the new recruit expected - the willing soldiers are forced to wait for hours in searing heat, while their day is punctuated by moments of terror. Drama, based on the autobiography by veteran Anthony Swofford, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Jamie Foxx, Peter Sarsgaard and Chris Cooper.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.

programme.desc: A woman goes to work as a cocktail waitress at a burlesque club which is teetering on the brink of closure. The manager gives her the chance to perform and she has soon become the venue's star attraction, drawing the attention of a sleazy developer with plans for the site. Musical drama, starring Cher, Christina Aguilera, Cam Gigandet and Stanley Tucci.

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: A team of investigative reporters for a Boston newspaper look into claims of children being molested within the Catholic church. The journalists discover the situation is far worse than it seemed, as they find a conspiracy among the city's legal, religious and government establishments to cover up decades of abuse. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams and Stanley Tucci.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: In the months leading up to the Second World War, a young London stockbroker attempts to rescue hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia. Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.desc: The story of Frank Abagnale Jr, who found notoriety as a teenager conning and charming his way across America. Posing as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer, Frank was able to fund an extravagant lifestyle while outwitting the FBI at every turn. Fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen and James Brolin.

programme.desc: In the late 18th century, a group of women create the Veuve Clicquot champagne business. Drama, starring Haley Bennett, Tom Sturridge and Sam Riley.

programme.desc: Riley, a young woman recently released from rehab, meets Ethan and finds herself navigating the line between love and a new addiction. Director Brittany Snow's romantic comedy drama, starring Courtney Eaton, Thomas Mann and Dave Bautista.

programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.(n)

programme.desc: Five teenagers who occupy different areas of their school's social structure are thrown together for a Saturday morning detention. During the day, they analyse their behaviour and find unexpected common ground. programme.desc: An alcoholic former professional player reluctantly agrees to train an all-female baseball team during the Second World War. With star player Dottie Hinson and her sister Kit on board, they look set to dominate the league - until sibling rivalry rears its head. Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.(n)

programme.title: Lady Bird
programme.desc: Golden Globe-winning comic drama, written and directed by Greta Gerwig. Artistic California teenager Lady Bird expects much from life. However, the strained relationship with her mother and failing family finances keep clipping her wings, while early romance leads to heartache. Saoirse Ronan, Laurie Metcalf and Tracy Letts star.(n)

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: A slow-witted man has a series of bizarre adventures, including becoming an American football star, Vietnam veteran, table tennis champion and millionaire businessman - but the love of his life from childhood continues to elude him. Robert Zemeckis's Oscar-winning comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Sally Field, Robin Wright and Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.desc: A stand-up comedian struggling with PTSD agonises over whether or not to join the search for a missing teenage girl she used to look after. Writer-director Ally Pankiw's comedy drama, starring Rachel Sennott and Olga Petsa.(n)

programme.title: A Mistake
programme.desc: A talented surgeon's life unravels after an inexperienced colleague makes a fatal mistake. Medical drama, starring Elizabeth Banks, Simon McBurney and Joel Tolbeck.(n)

programme.title: Between the Temples
programme.desc: A cantor in a crisis of faith has his world turned upside down when his school music teacher re-enters his life as his new adult bat mitzvah student. Comedy, starring Jason Schwartzman, Carol Kane and Dolly De Leon.(n)

programme.title: Omni Loop
programme.desc: A Florida woman decides to solve time travel in order to go back and be the person she always intended. Sci-fi drama, starring Mary-Louise Parker and Ayo Edebiri.(n)

programme.title: Rebellious
programme.desc: A princess is kidnapped by an evil sorcerer and her scholarly fiance must use his wits in an epic quest to find her, while she boldly challenges her captors and plots a daring escape. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Vanessa Johansson and Marc Thompson.(n)

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: A family tragedy woos Delia Deetz, daughter Lydia and rebellious teenage granddaughter Astrid back to the close-knit community of Winter River. Astrid accidentally opens a portal to the afterlife by summoning Beetlejuice three times. The mischievous demon ricochets between realms, wreaking havoc wherever he goes. Tim Burton's comedy sequel, starring Michael Keaton, Winona Ryder and Jenna Ortega.(n)

programme.title: Speak No Evil
programme.desc: On holiday in Europe, American couple Ben and Louise Dalton and their anxiety-crippled daughter Agnes meet English doctor Patrick Feld, his wife Ciara and their young son Ant, who was born without a tongue. The Daltons' vacation soon turns into a nightmare when they are invited to stay on the Felds' country estate. Horror, starring James McAvoy, Mackenzie Davis, Scoot McNairy and Aisling Franciosi.(n)

programme.title: Mob Cops
programme.desc: When a retired NYPD detective publishes a book about his family's mob connections, war breaks out between the police working for the city's big crime boss and the officers trying to bring them to justice. Crime drama, starring David Arquette and Kevin Connolly.(n)

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis. Two years after their disastrous trip to Las Vegas, the Wolf Pack head to Thailand for a stag party - but, as always, things don't go exactly to plan.

programme.title: The Hangover Part III
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis. History repeats itself for the Wolfpack when one of their group is kidnapped and they have to renew old acquaintances back in Las Vegas to secure his release.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones and Alicia Vikander. Now living in self-imposed exile, former agent Jason Bourne is contacted by an old colleague and is soon drawn into an operation to expose CIA dirty tricks. And, as Bourne well knows, nothing is as it seems and no one can be trusted.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as 'Beekeepers', he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dac

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: This Black History Month, join us as we take a look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaub's comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bradley Cooper, Zach Galifianakis and Ed Helms. Three friends wake up in a wrecked Vegas hotel room following a stag night for their friend Doug. As the day progresses the wild events of the night before fall into place - all they have to do now is find the groom.

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis. Two years after their disastrous trip to Las Vegas, the Wolf Pack head to Thailand for a stag party - but, as always, things don't go exactly to plan.

programme.title: The Hangover Part III
programme.desc: Comedy starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis. History repeats itself for the Wolfpack when one of their group is kidnapped and they have to renew old acquaintances back in Las Vegas to secure his release.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: Sci-fi comedy starring Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith. When a New York police officer is recruited by a top-secret agency that monitors alien activity he finds himself in a race against time to save the Earth from destruction.

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Leonardo DiCaprio as a corporate spy who steals ideas from dreams. But his latest, most dangerous assignment requires him to implant a thought and it pulls him deep into a battle with his own subconscious where he is haunted by memories of his dead love.

programme.title: It
programme.desc: Horror starring Jaeden Lieberher, Bill SkarsgÃ¥rd and Finn Wolfhard. In the summer of 1989, seven misfit children come together to investigate a series of mysterious tragedies in their town, and find themselves facing off against a demon that takes the shape of a terrifying clown.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Horror thriller starring Emily Blunt and John Krasinski. After blind insectoid monsters with super-sensitive hearing wipe out most of humanity, a family of survivors adapts to living in silence. But with a new baby on the way, their noiseless way of life is about to become a lot more difficult...

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaub's comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin.

programme.desc: A struggling single mother unknowingly gifts her son a doll imbued with a serial killer's consciousness.

programme.desc: Young Andy receives a special present from his mom -- a seemingly innocent Buddi doll that becomes his best friend. When the doll suddenly takes on a life of its own, Andy unites with other kids to stop the sinister toy from wreaking bloody havoc.

programme.desc: Young Marine Cpl. Megan Leavey starts to identify with Rex, a particularly aggressive combat dog that she trains. Together, they complete more than 100 missions until an improvised explosive device injures both, putting their fates in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Commandant's Shadow
programme.desc: Hans JÃ¼rgen HÃ¶ss, the 87-year-old son of Rudolf HÃ¶ss, faces his father's terrible legacy as he meets Auschwitz survivor Anita Lasker-Wallfisch. Hans enjoyed a happy childhood while Anita was trying to survive the concentration camp.
